As an AI language model, I do not have access to the latest updates on the government's policies related to carbon emissions. However, I can provide you with some examples of the policies that some governments have implemented to reduce carbon emissions. 

1. Carbon pricing: Some governments have implemented carbon pricing policies to incentivize businesses to reduce their carbon emissions. This policy works by putting a monetary price on each ton of carbon emitted, thereby making businesses accountable for their carbon emissions, and encouraging them to invest in more sustainable practices.

2. Renewable energy targets: Governments can set targets for the production and use of renewable energy. This encouragement can help shift the energy production of countries away from non-renewable resources such as oil, coal or gas towards cleaner and greener methods.

3. Fuel efficiency standards: Governments can implement fuel efficiency standards for vehicles, building equipment, and appliances, aimed at reducing carbon emissions caused by burning fossil fuels.

4. Sustainable Agriculture: Governments can encourage sustainable agriculture practices, which conserve soil and water resources, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and improve soil health.

Overall, governments around the world can implement various policies and programs aiming to reduce carbon emissions and environmental pollution. These programs would help in the transition to sustainable development and the preservation of the environment for future generations.
